Martene, particularly in that which concerns the ritual of ordination and the dedication of churches. It is, however, specially to the Roman Liturgy that I have directed my researches. Its history is clearly more interesting to us than that of any other, since for centuries it has been the only liturgy of the West.

Although Ι have not hesitated, when 1 found it possible, to go back earlier than the fourth century, Ι have, however, for the most part, confined myself to a less remote chronological period. Attention might be called to very interesting liturgical facts in docu- ments anterior to the time of Constantine, but they are isolated facts, and the documents are few, and rarely explicit.
